meanings.definition: Capable of being taken or seized.
meanings.sent1: The shiny diamond was very takable.
meanings.sent2: The small toy was easily takable by the child.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel found the bird feeder to be quite takable.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity to travel the world was a takable dream for her.
meanings.sent5: The delicious cake on the table looked incredibly takable.

meanings.definition: Able to be captured or apprehended.
meanings.sent1: The elusive criminal was finally found and proved to be takable.
meanings.sent2: The wild horse was surprisingly takable with the right approach.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the laser pointer was a takable enemy.
meanings.sent4: The truth, though hidden, was always takable in the end.
meanings.sent5: The secret treasure map was the most takable item in the old pirate's chest.
